remarks: Rays :  Definition 6.1 of [Schwabhauser] p. 43.  With this definition, ` A ( K `` C ) B ` means that ` A ` and ` B ` are on the same ray with initial point ` C ` .  This follows the same notation as Schwabhauser were rays are first defined as a relation.  It is possible to recover the ray itself using e.g. ` ( ( K `` C ) " { A } ) ` No new constant was introduced to define rays, the local class variable ` K ` is used instead.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Dec-2019.)
